intro: Statice langeana, commonly known as the Langeana glasswort, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family, which includes many species with showy flowers and succulent leaves. The plant is characterized by its tall, branched stems and clusters of small, spike-like flowers that range in color from pink to red. It thrives in saline and sandy soils, often found in dunes and coastal marshes. Due to its hardy nature and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens with well-drained soil and full sun.
